title: Quiz 5: Unit One Comprehensive Review
topicName: Unit One: Introduction to Reproductive Health
description: A comprehensive review covering Policies, Adolescent Health, Gender, and Safe Motherhood strategies.

questions.question: Match the core concept with its primary definition/focus:
questions.explanation: Gender=Social roles; Adolescence=Transition period; SMI=Safe pregnancy; EOC=Complication management.
questions.hint: Match the term to its definition.

questions.question: Which harmful practice is primarily responsible for scarring of genitalia and potential obstructed labour?
questions.explanation: FGM causes scarring which leads to obstructed labour and other complications.

questions.question: The maternal mortality ratio in Kenya was estimated at ___BLANK___ per 100,000 live births in 2003.
questions.explanation: KDHS 2003 estimated the MMR at 414 per 100,000 live births.
questions.hint: It is a number slightly above 400.

questions.question: Which of the following are strategies identified to support the implementation of RH services? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Strategies include HR development, Integration, Resource mobilization, and Operational research.

questions.question: Instrumental aggression is driven by anger and the desire to harm someone.
questions.explanation: Hostile aggression is driven by anger. Instrumental aggression is used to achieve a goal (like robbery) without necessarily being angry.
questions.hint: Think of a robber vs. a fight.

questions.question: Order the levels of the health care system from lowest (grassroots) to highest (referral):
questions.explanation: Community -> Dispensary/Health Centre -> District Hospital -> National Referral Hospital.

questions.question: What is the leading malignant disease among women in Kenya?
questions.explanation: Cancers of the cervix and breast are leading, but the text specifically highlights cervix as a key RH issue linked to early sexual activity.
questions.hint: It is related to the reproductive tract.

questions.question: Which term refers to the socially constructed roles of men and women?
questions.explanation: Gender refers to the economic, social, or cultural attributes associated with being male or female.

questions.question: Review the RH Rights statement below. Which international document defined this right?

richContent.content: '...the recognition of the basic right of all couples and individuals to decide freely and responsibly the number, spacing and timing of their children...'

questions.explanation: This definition comes from the 1994 Cairo Programme of Action (ICPD).

questions.question: Why is the adolescent girl particularly vulnerable to HIV/AIDS? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Biological immaturity of the reproductive tract
Lack of power to negotiate condom use
Exposure to older sexual partners (sugar daddies)

questions.explanation: Vulnerability is due to biological factors (immature tract), social factors (power imbalance), and economic factors (cross-generational sex).
questions.hint: Consider biological, social, and economic factors.
